reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the food- the paella, the ice cream, the breakfast omelets, the daily bbqs, the cappuccinos. Our favourite meal was at the a la carte at the Cuban Restaurant. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were great. I agree with the previous comment- if you tip well, you are well taken care of. The beach was amazing- we spent every day on the beach. Lots of activities.
reviews.title: Great place! Great Value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definitely would like to go back next year for two weeks to take more of Cuban in!
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time ! Would certainly go back :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a tip to anyone going to Cuba- we brought powdered Gatorade with us, to keep us hydrated from the heat and drink.
reviews.title: Had a great time for the price we paid. Going again next year.

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to Aguas Azules the last week of February. It was the first time for both of us . At the beginning we were worried about this hotel after reading some nasty reviews but to be honest I had little to no complaints at all. The beach was beautiful (cristal clear water), our room was clean with a great view, the people who worked there were always friendly , we met people from all over the world and going into town was fabulous(double decker bus can take you every hour into town). I had heard a lot of complaints about bugs but the only time i really saw ants was if we dropped food on the floor. The room and hotel was always clean though. I also heard a lot of complaints about noise and parties but to be honest that was never a real problem for us. Some nights were louder but you have to realize that you will find this anywhere. There were also lots of families and older people there so it is not a hotel that is just filled with teenagers on spring break. The only complaint I really had was with the food but it wasn't as terrible as people say ; just a little different and not much variety. As far as à la cartes go though we went to two and the Cuban one was by far my favourite. The chicken was to die for. My last little comment is there are many people out there that are never satisfied but if you go there with an open mind and with the idea that it is a new country you will be fine ! I highly recommend this hotel to many people :) I had a ball :)
reviews.title: Good for the price
Great time Great place
reviews.text: The people there are great. The food is ok. You will not starve there. Alot of walking to get anywhere but it is well worth it. The beach is fantastic we spent the whole week on the beach. The pools were clean too but did not attend them.
Hotel
reviews.title: The in need of remodernisation! Not Bad

likes.liked: — The well presented grounds outside, the pool and the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in October for 2 weeks.
reviews.title: pros and cons

reviews.text: Set along side other hotels. Good appearance on the outside and the lobby/check in area is all very nice but the rooms in general are in need of updating.
reviews.title: Had a blast at Club Amigo!

likes.liked: — The staff, Cuban vacationers, Beach, Pool

reviews.title: Nice spacious grounds, excellent wide white sand beach,
reviews.text: Leaks in the dining room would often occur and some of the sofa's in seating areas were dirty (on our last day they had a delivery of more sofa's which were exchange with some of the present ones).
Room: Very big with a large size bathroom area. Always kept clean, maid does a good job. Wardrobe space - very outdated and in need of a complete overhaul. Plenty of space to store suitcases etc.
reviews.title: A real 3 star El-Cheapo Hotel

likes.disliked: — Service was a big 0. There was too many cubans and they were serving us as we were cubans.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, Club Amigo seemed fine with a nice clean reception area. However, it all changed pretty quickly. We were upgraded to a suite as we were on honeymoon which was quite good with two balconies which took in the sunset. There was no light in the bedroom however which was a bit of a pain.
reviews.title: Prison /School Canteen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was about 5 mins from the hotel and was beautiful. Clear water with little fishes swimming around your toes. We were there in September and it was very quiet, probably not even half full.
reviews.title: Canadians will love this hotel

reviews.text: The food at this place was absolutely shocking as was the "school canteen" where you were forced to eat. I wont even try to describe some of the food and how much they must have spent but considering that in one of Varadero's better restuarants a 3 course meal with drinks costs <£10, they were definately not putting the effort in. My advice would be get to the grill bar at lunchtime, much better atmosphere. Avoid the food at the beach bar, its rubbish.
reviews.title: Good Experience Overall--don't let the other reviews scare you

reviews.text: I dont understand the whole "we are French and have different wrist bands" thing.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Stay overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stick to drinking as much rum and beer as you can to get rid of the taste of the food. Alternatively eat out in Varadero as its cheap and the places we went to were excellent.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — resort is in need of some upgrades

reviews.text: We went to Aguas Azules Mar2 to Mar9. We had been there before and I had a blast last time!! This time we were flying down with 19 people and many were checking this site to see about the trip. Many negative reviews were read so there was a lot of nervousness....even the four of us that were there last year were getting nervous!!!
reviews.title: Our large group had a very good time!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had arrived at the hotel at noon. As many discuss, there is minimal people at the front desk so things moved very slowly! However, we all did manage to get ALL of our bungalows without a hitch and we were four hours early for check in!!!
reviews.title: Great Stay! Exceeded My Expectations!

reviews.text: Grounds keepers were very friendly, rooms were clean, drinks were cold and kept on flowing!!! Food....well.....same as last year....a bit bland, boring, and repetitive!! When people say that there is always something to eat....we did have a couple of people that would eat rice and bread for some of the meals. However, that being said we were not there for the food and nobody went hungry! There was always something that was cooked that looked unappealing, but we always found food that we enjoyed.
reviews.title: You make your own trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only real issues that we had was that toilet paper appeared to be very rationed...one of our groups (we had 10 bungalows for our group) had no toilet paper for a day or so...I guess once you get a roll, stash it before the maids clean your room so you have an extra roll for the week. Other than one bungalow out of 10 we all had enough tp for our stay and never ran out....
reviews.title: Great Stay! Amazing memories!

reviews.text: The beach is still amazing and after walking for quite a ways, it appears as though this is the best beach around! We walked behind many other hotels in Varadero and their beaches seemed to be a bit rocky, or a bit steep, or just not as clean. I feel that Aguas Azules beach is by far the best in the area.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Aguas Azules from March 9 to 16, 2011. We thoroughly enjoyed this resort (and Cuba in general). I've never stayed in a 5 star resort, but I'm not sure what would could be better than this that I'd pay more money for. We got everything we wanted here. We ate beef, turkey, pork, chicken and seafood dinners, and there was bacon at breakfast (which is important to me because some resorts I've been to didn't have any). Being in Varadero, we enjoyed the resort which is on the outskirt of town, and sometimes took the bus into the city as well as Plaza Americanas (a nice variety). We took one "excursion" to break up the week and had a great time. This resort was full and you can get a lounge chair on the beach in the shade or sun ANYTIME! The pictures I took were prime time for sun and swim! There was no "reserving" with towels draped over the chairs for hours on end with no one there.
reviews.title: So many good things to say

reviews.text: The only thing that wasn't "top notch" for me were the pillows which were flat and hard - and my husband's snoring. I'd go back in a second.
reviews.title: Average hotel - worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The recent reviews pretty much sum up our experience, just a few notes:
reviews.title: Nice Place Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE PROPERTY
reviews.title: if you stay here, make sure you book in the bungalos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the resort claims they only have 411 rooms, the property is very large. It looks like part of the hotel is closed and not being used. There is a lot of walking and stairs. We travelled with my mom who is older and it made it a bit more difficult. Although there are some elevators, they are not everywhere - and don't work all the time. We stayed in a regular room. It was more than adequate. Clean, spacious enough. A few English TV channels including CNN. No RCA ports in case your kids want to bring a gaming system to connect to it. It’s true – no facecloths and the towels are a bit small. Bring your own pillows. They do supply shampoo and soap. The safety deposit box is 1 peso per day. We had an evening flight back home so for 25 pesos we got to keep the room until 6pm. Well worth it.
reviews.title: We got what we expected and perhaps a little more..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Club Amigo last September and was generally disappointed, the rooms were fine and comfortable enough, staff were average no complaints but nothing memorable either, the pool was also fine, but food was a real problem I appreciate that generally food in Cuba is pretty basic but really without breakfast we were sunk, it was very hard to get booked into any of the restaurants which closed early and so we tended to fill up at the pool bar ...burgers and chips and more burgers and chips!!!
reviews.title: Nothing to write home about!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: On the plus side the room housekeeping was very good and the position with the beach by the hotel is just beautiful like sitting in a warm clear bath with fish..luxury... We were also really impressed by the tours booked through the hotel to the surrounding area especially the jeep safari and motor boat driving which was great, my partner thought he was James Bond for the day.
reviews.title: HATED IT!
very nice place
reviews.text: Overall the potential seems to be there but just isn't being met....

SIGNATURE! Never again! Absolutley hated this hotel! Ghetto! TERRIBLE FOOD! I paid to starve myself, i literally lost 4 pounds in a week. Bed sheets were not being changed due to "saving water", as stated on a note beside our bed! NO KETCHUP! NO NOTHING>>>>>FOOD SUCKED!
reviews.title: You Couldn't Pay Me to Stay Here Again!

reviews.text: TIPS! Left right and centre, I understand they are needy people and dont have nothin but WhatTheF.? The bathrooms were so stinky, you could pass out. The maid we had was an angel, Lucy, she was amazing! LOVED her! The beach was also very pretty and beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, the front desk does not speak english well, ...
Great Value!
reviews.text: First off, i'd like to say that I find it funny when people make arbitrary opinions in these reviews.....They post opinions that are specific to their personal (and isolated) experiences. For example: The food, and the rudeness of other patrons.

...Cuba is pretty much considered a thrid world country so one would have to assume you can't expect much from the food. That being said, I think the food at Club Amigo was excellent not compared to Canadian standards, but compared to Cuban standards. Some of the patrons were VERY rude....Pushing other patrons around, some of the kids were licking certain items at the buffet and putting them back. I got pushed out of the way by some little girl for some juice. These patrons all belonged to a specific nation, and I won't divulge what that nation was, but it's no wonder that the staff acted the way they did.
reviews.title: We Loved our Trip!

reviews.text: I found the staff to be helpful, but not courteous. I can't say I blame them because they were getting ordered around all week by all these people from this nation that we shall not name. Nevertheless, they met all my needs.
reviews.title: Patience is a virtue!
A wonderful dream: Varadero
reviews.text: This place was PHENOMENAL for 3+star resort. All my friends told me that i'd regret it. It was clean, the air conditioning worked well, the pool was clean, the beach was just a 5 minute garden walkway away....There's the Mambo Club right next door, and downtown was only a 5 minute cab ride away. The bar wasn't 24 hours, and the food wasn't 24 hours, so that was the only setback.
Other than that, this place get's a big thumbs up from me, and I might even be staying at Club Amigo again in a month or so.
reviews.title: Full of potential, but...

reviews.text: Just returned from Aguas Azules stayed from March 21st-28th. On our first day, there were alot of irate customers at the check in counter, it appears that the hotel was overbooked, some people were made to wait for hours until they resolved the room issues. A piece of advice for anyone in management who may read these reviews, your hotel would be wise to spend some time in retraining the check in personnel, they were not only unfriendly but extremely disorganized. It's your first impression, and a good experience can go a long way to enhance your overall stay. I watched as one of the women at the front argued with one of the customers that they must have the incorrect room number, would not take their word that they had the correct number, the guests went back to their room to reconfirm that they had the correct room number, turns out someone had assigned the room to someone else, since I spoke Spanish, I was able to follow her conversation with her coworker, but I did not at any point hear her apologize to the customer. This is one example, of the many that I witnessed over the week. I too had a few instances where the lobby service was less than stellar, alot of the women there seemed unhappy with their work.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: Positives, grounds of the resorts are very pretty, staff is very friendly, beach as always is beautiful. Buffet very busy, selection was limited as most reviews say. The rooms in the hotel, are very worn, walls are paper thin, so you will always be able to hear what your neighbours are up to. You can always find something to eat, but food at times was cold. I have been to Cuba many times, but this was my first time at a 3 star, If price is an issue, I would say spend a little extra and upgrade to a better hotel. If you have already booked, you won't necessarily regret it.
reviews.title: If you've already booked, keep an open mind and make the best of it!

reviews.text: I just returned from a one week stay at Aguas Azules. This was my third time in Cuba, my first time in Varadero, and my first time at a 3 star. I travelled with a group of 8 friends, and we booked this place because all the reviews said it was a good place to party . . .and it was. We all had a great time, and while there were many wonderful things about the resort, it also came with a lot of bad. My advice would be to spend a little more and go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Had a great week!

reviews.text: The hotel itself was pretty run down. There were many areas in need of serious repair, and not much to look at in terms of decoration, etc. The hallways were dark, and the stairways looked like underground parking garages. Even the main lobby was on the ugly side. Our room was really nice though, and very clean which is way more important than how stuff looks. The beds were comfortable, the shower worked great, we had lots of hot water, and no toilet issues. We had requested adjoining rooms, which we were given, and we had a balcony over looking one of the pool areas. As people have mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is very large, and it is a bit of a walk to get anywhere. It is also hard to find your way around at first, as there aren't really any directional signs, and the ones at are there don't make any sense.
reviews.title: Best beach, friendly people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS AND BARS
reviews.title: Pros and Cons
